text.0: your spy hath called to you to give prosperity i sing to heaven and earth and offer sacrifice.
text.1: they bathe their steeds and hasten through the firmament they spread abroad their radiance through the sea of cloud.
text.2: earth shakes and reels in terror at their onward rush like a full ship which quivering lets the water in.
text.3: marked on their ways are they visible from afar the heroes press between in mighty armament.
text.4: as the exalted horn of bulls for splendid might as the suns eye set in the firmaments expanse.
text.5: like vigorous horses ye are beauteous to behold and for your glory show like bridegrooms o ye men.
text.6: who o ye maruts may attain the mighty lore of you the mighty who may reach your manly deeds.
text.7: ye verily make earth tremble like a ray of light what time ye bring your boons to give prosperity.
text.8: like steeds of ruddy colour scions of one race as foremost champions they have battled in the van.
text.9: the heroes have waxed strong like we1grown manly youths with floods of rain they make the suns eye fade away.
text.10: having no eldest and no youngest in their band no middlomost preeminent they have waxed in might.
text.11: these sons of pṛśni sprung of noble ancestry come hitberward to us ye bridegrooms of the sky.
text.12: like birds of air they flew with might in lengthened lines from heavens high ridges to the borders of the sky.
text.13: the steeds who carry them as gods and mortals know have caused the waters of the mounuains to desgend.
text.14: may dyaus the infinite roar for our banquet may dawns toil for us glittering with moisture.
text.15: lauded by thee these maruts sons o rudra o Ṛṣi have sent down the heavenly treasure.
